TO GET STARTED

 Make sure to hit Always Allow in location settings for the Noti-Fi app, this only ensures that it can find your wi-fi connection. 


Click here for a tutorial
________________________________________________


ADDING A WIFI NETWORK

 Step 1: Click Manage Saved Wifi Networks

 Step 2: To save the wifi that you are currently connected to, click Save Current Wifi To Favourites or manually enter the SSID and click Add 


________________________________________________


DELETING A SAVED WIFI

 Step 1: Click Manage Saved Wifi Networks

 Step 2: Choose the Wifi you want to delete from the dropdown menu

 Step 3: Once selected, click Delete Selected Wifi


________________________________________________


CREATE NEW NOTIFICATION

 Step 1: Click Create New Notification

 Step 2: Enter notification description

 Step 3: Select one of your saved Wifi networks from the options

 Step 4: Click Save


________________________________________________


DELETING A NOTIFICATION

 Step 1: Click Delete Noti-Fi

 Step 2: Select the Wifi network for the notification that you want to delete

 Step 3: Click Delete

Why Does This App Need Location Services?

 In order for the app to see when you connect to a wifi network, location services must be enabled and set to always allow.

 Does the app use GPS?

 Nope!

 Why Is There A Notification Always On?

 Android now requires all apps running in the background to have an active notification.

 What is running in the background?

 The task running in the background is waiting for a wifi change, nothing else.

 How does the app work?

 When your phone connects to wifi, the app will see which network you connect to. It will then check if you have made a notification for this wifi network. If you have, it will send the notification to your phone.

 Who Created This App?

 3 TRU students have made this app for a final project :).
